author: Tommy Efreeti

text:
From what I've gathered online, this game is a life sim about a depressed Japanese hikikomori. You play as God and it's your goal to turn his life around.
Apparently he joined a band and became super famous, but somebody started spreading rumors about him and his life went down the drain.
One scene shows a news station reporting on a (very likely fake) rumor about his father abusing him as a child. The next day, one of the protagonist's fans decides to stab his father and he later dies in the hospital.
According to Giant Bomb, this game's story was also written by Tomoko Sasaki, the composer of this track. She cited an interest in watching people through webcams as her source of inspiration.

author: Arctic foox

text: This is so Bossa Nova inspired it hurts, especially a lot of the vocal melodies and rhythms. I still have to wrap my brain around this being in English. Very, very accented English, like someone singing in a language they are not fluent in (most likely case) but still English lol. I think that's why there is such an unexplainable charm about it. It's familiar, yet unfamiliar at the same time. It's an odd sensation.

author: Ryan Indiefest

text:
The sequel to our favorite Dreamcast boxart, and our protagonist is probably crying at how good the soundtrack of his two games are. I did some research on Serani Poji and it's actually a group composed of Tomoko Sasaki (composer for Ristar and the NiGHTS series) and vocalist Yumi Higashino. Honestly, this track is up there with my favorite bossa nova songs. Truly a feel-good group. Oh and I challenge you to listen to this song for a few minutes before reading this next part...





...





It's actually in English and I posted the lyrics in the description.

author: Jacob Hepworth-Wain

text: yep! the music is composed and written by tomoko sasaki, with vocalists changing every few albums; manamoon's vocals were done by yukichi, then yumi higashino took over vocals starting with one-room survival. in their latest album merry go round jailhouse, tomoko herself does the vocals! all of them are amazing <3 i can only hope they come back soon but it seems tomoko is busy with a family-run business and producing other music for franchises such as idolmaster!
